description.narrative: Knife Capital (International) Fund III LP (Knife III or the Fund) is targeted to be a US$50 million Venture Capital (VC) fund focused on investments in the scale up or expansion (Series B) stage primarily in South Africa. The Fund aims to invest in high-growth, innovative technology companies with strong IP and potential for pan-African and global expansion in sectors including: Platform Businesses, Software, Tech-enabled business services, and FinTech.

Project Outcomes:
While the country has several accelerators/incubators and early stage Fund Managers, access to equity at later stages of the life cycle is scarce. It should also be noted that the Africa region more broadly has some of the lowest VC penetration rates compared to other emerging markets and South Africa can serve as a hub to incubate startups and then scale them to serve the broader African markets. Hence, this Fund will increase access to equity and operational value add for startups in South Africa that will expand into other African countries. Further, most of the investees of the previous fund have successfully expanding into neighboring countries or have a clear business plan to do so over the next years as well.
Contribution to Market Creation:
The largest contribution to market creation is expected to come from the sector specific impacts of digital investees.
Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund is expected to invest in innovative businesses models that strengthen supply chains, improve price transparency and have a demonstration effect by catalyzing replication from new entrants. In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market players, this innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a markets competitiveness by pushing traditional players to innovate.
Increased competitiveness of South Africas VC market: IFC anticipates the Fund will demonstrate the viability of Series B venture capital in South Africa by attracting more investors and incentivizing more entrepreneurs to start businesses.
